title: Question 6
prompt:
Sentence 9: Third degree burns destroy all layers of the skin, they harm underlying tissue.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, chose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Both “Third degree burns destroy all layers of skin” and “they harm underlying tissue” are independent clauses. In other words, they could stand alone as complete sentences. They should not be joined by just a comma. You could add the word “and” after the comma to join the two independent clauses, but since both clauses have the same subject (“they” refers to “third degree burns”), you can remove the word “they” and join the two verb phrases with the word “and.”


Third degree burns destroy all layers of the skin and harm underlying tissue.
